snippet: Months after a bitter strike by drivers, the Bloomberg administration said that new contracts for 4,100 school bus routes would save $400 million over several years.
abstract: Bloomberg administration says city will save $400 million over several years by awarding new contracts for thousands of school bus routes, the focus of a bruising fight with the drivers’ union and a monthlong strike earlier in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Months after a bitter strike by drivers, the Bloomberg administration said that new contracts for 4,100 school bus routes would save $400 million over several years.

headline.main: New York City Putting Bus Routes Out for Bid
headline.print_headline: City Putting Bus Routes Out for Bid
